comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The useful date "26-1-99" implies this was the Anniversary Day (now known as Australia Day) Regatta. The flagship was the 'Koenigin Luise' 1896 (North German Lloyd Company), moored off Neutral Bay out of shot to the right. Read all about it - SMH 27/1/1899 p.5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14197303 . Perhaps a photo of the 'Koenigin Luise' will turn up in the series?

comment.author: 88712892@N04
comment._content:
I am searching for photograps of 16ft skiffs from the 1920's, particularly
four of interest called Vaucluse, Daph, Arlene and Wyvern.  These were 
all successful (winning state championships) on Sydney Harbour but ended
up on either Newcastle Harbour or Lake Macquarie.  If anyone has 
photographs of these I am very interested. rasteel@live.com.au - Roger

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/88712892@N04] Apologies for the delay in replying. In answer to your query, the museum has quite a few photographs of skiffs, but in most cases we have not been able to identify the names of the skiffs and most of the sizes we have identified have been estimates. If you are aware of the specific emblems, we have tried to include that in the titles of the images. If you would like to see other images of skiffs, most them will be in the William Hall collection.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
